title: Foundations of Social Studies Instructional Design Using Constructivism and Systems Theory

context.prior_knowledge: Expert-level knowledge and experience in solving complex problems
context.additional_context: Focuses on experiencing and interpreting systems thinking-based instructional design in social studies for pre-service teachers. Implements active learning in smartphone-centric constrained environments

learning_goals: Learners can explain core concepts of systems theory by applying them to social studies education contexts.
Learners can develop at least two activity scenarios for social studies instructional design following constructivist principles.
Learners can design and evaluate a systems-based social studies lesson model executable in smartphone environments.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
